intro: Dracocephalum ruyschiana var. japonicum, commonly known as Japanese dragonhead, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, two-lipped flowers in shades of purple and blue, typically arranged in spikes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long flowering period.
